meanings.definition: Clingfishes: plural noun, a type of small fish that has a suction cup-like structure on its belly to cling to rocks and other surfaces in the water.
meanings.sent1: The clingfishes in the aquarium were fascinating to watch as they stuck to the glass with their suction cups.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of colorful clingfishes clinging to the coral reef while snorkeling.
meanings.sent3: The clingfishes decided to have a race to see who could cling to the rock the longest.
meanings.sent4: The clingfishes held onto the underwater cliff like tiny superheroes with their suction cups.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the clingfishes' ability to stick to any surface in the water.
